title: Like It Happened Yesterday (2013)(gnv64)
description:
Like It Happened Yesterday (Times Music India, 2013)
Songs that take you on a walk down memory lane
Based on the book of the same name by Ravinder Singh.

It is the celebration of nostalgia!
The release of my third novel, Like It Happened Yesterday, has been nothing short of overwhelming. I'm flooded with people sharing their childhood memories and their growing up adventures. Why? Because in the book I invoke the happy and the sad, the challenging and the hearteningÃ¢â‚¬â€the everlasting memories from the 80s!
The magical yet uncomplicated time when we didn't have LCDs and LEDs with hundreds of TV channels, but the entire country happily watched Mahabharata on DDI; When Internet, mobile phones, ATM cards and host of other gadgets had not invaded our lives. Life was simple. I wanted to bring a slice of it to you.
And it all started with Sangram, the CEO of Think WhyNot, who suggested the idea of creating a special song for this nove Ever since, it has been an exciting journey from reading the first set of lyrics, to listening to the first music track till the fine outcome. That vision has now become a reality with the lead song Mano kal hi ki baat hai sung by Shaan and composed by Siddhartth Suhas. The track was produced by Raajeev Sharma, a veteraii in the music industry.
I also love the fact that, besides Mano kal hi ki baat hai, which beautiful y captures the essence of those days, this album comprises of various other very famous and haunting nostalgic number;;. We all have heard them, during our growing up days and therefore they connect quite well to the theme.
Come join us as we celebrate the simplicity of those good ol'days that we fondly remember in this album!
